description: Translate all rows with a species code

translation_rules: padConcat({inventory_id, src_filename, map_sheet_id, orig_stand_id, ogc_fid}, {4,15,10,10,7}, {'x','x','x','x','x'}, '-', TRUE, TRUE)
description: Concatenates five attributes to create CAS_ID

Map structure percent. The defined ranges are 0: 0-9%, 1: 10-19%, 2: 20-29%, 3: 30-39%, 4: 40-49%, 5: 50-59%, 6: 60-69%, 7: 70-79%, 8: 80-89%, 9: 90-100%. Many polygons source values sum to 10 so to avoid exceeding 100% cover we use 1% for the first class, and then reduce 1% from the lower bound for all other clases. Note that source value can be zero when there is a species to indicate 0-10%. But zero is also used as null when there is no species assigned. Since the row_translation_rule only translates when the species has a value, we shouldn't incorectly translate any null zeros.

translation_rules: pc02_countOfNotNull(v1sp1, v2sp1, v3sp1, v4sp1, v5sp1, v6sp1, v7sp1, v1pcm, v2pcm, v3pcm, v4pcm, v5pcm, v6pcm, v7pcm, shrln, 'translation', 'species_code_mapping', 'pc02_species_codes', layer)
description: Determine if species are present using the lookup table, and if NFL are present. Then count layers and assign layer number based on the layer being translated.
Assigned UNKNOWN_VALUE when PRODUCTIVE_TYPE is ALDER. Default value is NOT_APPLICABLE
When dominant species is alder, we assigned ALDER as PRODUCTIVE_TYPE
